newsitem.title: USA: Calif. schools chief to seek $3 bln for facilities.
newsitem.headline: Calif. schools chief to seek $3 bln for facilities.

text.p: California state Superintendent of Public Instruction Delaine Eastin said on Thursday she would ask lawmakers to approve $3 billion of bonds for construction and modernization of public schools.

Eastin told Reuters she would ask state lawmakers early next year to approve the issuance of revenue bonds for a large portion of the $3 billion total. She said she would ask lawmakers to place the remaining portion on the ballot.
"We hope that the governor and legislature agree to give us the bonding authority," Eastin said. "I think this is a lot more important than (bonds for) prisons."
Eastin said the $3 billion of bonds would provide $2 billion to modernize public school facilities and construct schools to house the fast-growing student population.
The proposed bond funds would also provide $1 billion to construct the classrooms that will be needed to fully implement the state's new class-size reduction plan.
Eastin said the state has not allocated enough money to build classrooms to implement the class-size reductions.
